means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 梅辛杰职业名称，来源于中世纪英语及古法语，含义是“信使”(carrier of messages)

sentence.Network_en: The messenger bent and scratched at his knee where the strapping chafed.
sentence.Network_cn: 送信人弯下腰来，挠着膝部被绑腿磨红的地方。

sentence.Network_en: He sent the order by messenger.
sentence.Network_cn: 他通过邮递员发出订单。

sentence.Network_en: By the time the messenger reached him, the damage had been done.
sentence.Network_cn: 送信人赶到他那儿时, 损失已经造成了.

jx.jx_en_mean: treat the bearer of bad news as if they were to blame for it
jx.jx_cn_mean: 将怨气发在报坏消息者身上

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Northern French messanger, variant of Old French messager, from Latin missus (see message)

entry.def: A messenger takes a message to someone, or takes messages regularly as their job.

example.ex: There will be a messenger at the Airport to collect the photographs from our courier...
example.tran: 机场会有一名信使从我们的递送员手中取走照片。

example.ex: He gave the instruction for the document to be sent by messenger.
example.tran: 他下令由通信员送出文件。

means.word_mean: 1. a person who carries a message
